snippet: J. Christopher Stevens, who was killed at a diplomatic mission in Libya, had an affection for Arab culture and street life that made him many friends and contacts.
abstract: J Christopher Stevens, the American ambassador to Libya who was killed in an assault on a diplomatic mission there, had an affection for Arab culture and street life that made him many friends and contacts; friends and colleagues say that he was unique in that he often traded personal risk for personal contact.
lead_paragraph: J. Christopher Stevens, who was killed at a diplomatic mission in Libya, had an affection for Arab culture and street life that made him many friends and contacts.

headline.seo: An American Ambassador Who Plunged Into Arab Life
headline.main: A U.S. Envoy Who Plunged Into Arab Life
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Envoy Who Plunged Into Arab Life
